title: Biden Consoles Family Members in Florida Condo Disaster
sub_head: President receives briefing from search-and-rescue officials and speaks of importance of cooperation between federal and local officials
body:
President Biden consoled family members of those killed or unaccounted for in the partially collapsed condominium in Surfside, Fla., praising emergency responders and local leaders who have led the search for the missing.
“Never give up hope,” Mr. Biden told a group of friends and relatives Thursday in a private meeting, which was recorded by an attendee and posted on Instagram. A White House official confirmed the video’s authenticity.
The president, drawing on his own experiences of grief, said: “The people you may have lost, they’re gonna be with you your whole life—a part of your soul, a part of who you are.”
Mr. Biden, joined by first lady Jill Biden, traveled to the Miami area to receive a briefing from search-and-rescue officials and to meet with relatives of the residents of Champlain Towers South, where 145 people remain unaccounted for. There have been 18 confirmed deaths since last week’s collapse.
Officials said Thursday that work at the condominium site had been halted because of concerns about the stability of the section of the building that is still standing.
